turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Camel (cigarette).
turn.1: What happened to Camel during the 1920s?
turn.2: In races where tobacco sponsorship was forbidden, the Camel name was replaced with either the Camel logo or with ""Williams"" instead.
turn.3: What other competitions did Camel participate in?
turn.4: Camel sponsored the ""Camel Team"" in the late 1980s to early 1990s in the Paris-Dakar Rally. Camel organised the Camel Trophy, a vehicle-oriented competition that was held annually between 1980 and 2000.
turn.6: It was best known for its use of Land Rover vehicles over challenging terrain.
turn.7: What other competitions did Camel sponsor?
turn.8: In the 1994 Winston Cup season of NASCAR, Camel sponsored Hut Stricklin's #23 Ford Thunderbird and from 1995 to 1997, Camel sponsored Jimmy Spencer's #23 Ford Thunderbird.
turn.9: What other races did Camel sponsor?
turn.10: From 1972 until 1993, Camel was the title sponsor of the then-popular IMSA auto racing series, titled as Camel GT. Camel was a sponsor of the United States Hot Rod Association.
turn.11: What did you find interesting about the article?
turn.12: They featured the ""Camel Mud & Monster Series"", which ran from 1990 to 1994. Camel sponsored the Sito Pons MotoGP team from 2003 until the team's departure from MotoGP racing in 2005.
